comment: Pleasant dry  Irish start with a surprising bourbon aftertaste
It's like a rye field punched you in the mouth. A good punch.
Best cheap rye that's readily available in PA
Nice spice but bland. Contradiction? It just seems a little bit light. Still, a nice change from the norm.
Used this for a homemade Rock n Rye
Jim Beam (Rye if available) + Club Soda = My most common bar drink.
Little bit of sweet on the nose, but equal parts alchohol burn.  Really muted flavour and too much burn. Not a fan. Would opt for rittenhouse over this
Grew up putting it in hot tea with lemon and honey when sick. Still first choice for that.

Not terribly special neat, although it was my first rye so I didn't know what to expect. A light spice on the palate. If you must mix whiskey, this is fantastic in coke. It retains plenty of flavor if you're not trying to drown it.
Similar profile to Jim Beam, but rye...tho less spicy than rye.
As some have mentioned this my first Rye.  I find it to be a very lite easy drinker. The start is similar to Jamason but the finish and after taste spicy and full flavorful.
Raw but caramel colored? Quick bottled and cheap tasting.
First "Rye" I ever had...  That was more than 30 years ago.
I don't know why Jim Murray has such a high opinion of this.  Mayber it was good decades ago, but not for the past several years.  It is, however, cheap.
Had this in an old fashioned. I was really hoping it would be good because I need a cheap mixer, but it wasn't. All burn and no taste.
staple whiskey. Moderate all around. mild spice on the nose. balanced sweet and spicy up front. Finishes mild sweet

Nose: Cherry, caramelized banana, nutmeg, white chocolate
Palate: Vanilla, cinnamon, red apples
Finish: Black pepper, cherry

It's very smooth and doesn't linger very long after taking a sip, it kind of fades into the background rather quickly. It's a good beginner rye and probably best utilized when mixing cocktails.

Nose is vanilla spice and sweet and light oak

Palate is spice, plenty rye in this!


Finish is smooth dry woody and spice.

Good rye.

Nose: Some spices - nutmeg, white pepper, cloves. Very simple and one dimensional.

Plate: Bland. More caramel and bourbon-like than any other rye I've tasted, but very low key.

Finish: Barely any at all - the palate just dwindles quickly.

The least impressive rye I've tasted - it seems to be diluted to the point where all character has vanished.

"Inferior" : 1 star

Spicy!  Caveat:  this review is with ice. I had this at a local watering hole on the rocks. 

Nose: vanilla, overripe bananas, and rye spice. 

Palate: spice at the beginning, followed by earthiness/wet soil mid-palate (in a good way), accompanied by more spice. 

Finish: dry and spicy with a bitter, rye bread note. The mid-palate, finish, and aftertaste all have a thread of dark chocolate running through them. 

I liked this a lot - maybe it was the good company and the fact that we were celebrating. Perhaps I will try again neat and in a place where I can be more objective. It didn't seem like a $20 USD bottle of rye whisky. I agree with the expert rating and give it 86 points for four stars, factoring in price/value.
